title: Government Levels and Democracy

vocab.definition: A system of government where people vote to choose their leaders
The national government that makes laws for the whole country
The government that makes laws for just one state
The government that makes laws for cities and towns
Someone chosen to speak and act for a group of people
The branch of government that makes laws
The branch of government that carries out and enforces laws
The branch of government that interprets laws and runs the courts
The elected leader of a state
The elected leader of a city or town
The highest law that sets up government and protects rights
The system where power is shared by national and state governments
Dividing government power among three branches
Ways each branch can limit the others so no branch becomes too strong
A change or addition to the Constitution
The first ten amendments that list many individual rights
When a leader refuses to approve a law
A local law made by a city or town
The area or kinds of cases a government or court has power over

teachingNotes: Explain the three levels of government and their different responsibilities. Discuss how democratic elections work and why voting is important. Compare roles of different government officials.

sample.question: What are the three levels of government in the United States?
Who leads the executive branch at the federal level?
What does the legislative branch do?
What does the judicial branch do?
expectedAny: decides if laws follow the Constitution
